summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 29, 2020, in which the New York office's Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) requests assistance for the ongoing investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. It highlights the high-profile nature of the case and seeks available agents to help.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the subjects (along with Ghislaine Maxwell) of the ongoing high-profile investigation for which Squad C-20 is requesting assistance.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as one of the subjects (along with Jeffrey Epstein) of the ongoing high-profile investigation for which Squad C-20 is requesting assistance.

connections.description: Both are named as subjects of the same ongoing FBI investigation, indicating their alleged involvement in related criminal activities.

events.title: FBI Squad C-20 Requests Assistance
events.description: The FBI's New York Squad C-20 (VCAC/HT) sends an internal email requesting agent assistance for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, describing it as a high-profile case.

keyFacts: The FBI's New York Squad C-20, which handles Violent Crime Against Children/Human Trafficking (VCAC/HT), was actively seeking assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation as of July 2020.
The investigation was described internally as a 'high profile case' and a 'unique opportunity' for agents.
The document indicates the investigation into Epstein and Maxwell was ongoing and active well after Epstein's death in 2019, focusing on Maxwell.
